meanings.def: the act or process of passing something from one person, place or thing to another
examples: Classes are based on discussion rather than on the one-way transmission of knowledge.
The disease affects the transmission of messages from the nerve endings to the brain.
The virus's usual transmission route is by sneezing.
It is not known how far genetic transmission is responsible for the condition.
transmission from one aircraft to another

meanings.def: the act or process of sending out an electronic signal or message or of broadcasting a radio or television programme
examples: the transmission of computer data along telephone lines
a break in transmission (= of a radio or television broadcast) due to a technical fault
Do you know the date of transmission?
There will be simultaneous transmission of the concert on TV and radio.
The first transmission of the programme was on October 2 1952.

meanings.def: a radio or television message or broadcast
examples: The duet is taken from a 1943 radio transmission.

meanings.def: the system in a vehicle by which power is passed from the engine to the wheels
